title: Following are the top foreign stories at 1700 hours
snippet: Modi to meet US Vice President Kamala Harris, hold bilaterals with Japanese and Australian PMs on Thursday Washington: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday is scheduled to have as many as eight meetings, including with Vice President Kamala Harris, on the first working day of his current US trip. By Lalit K Jha FGN20 G4-UNSC-REFORMS Indispensable to reform UN Security Council, make it more legitimate, representative: G4 nations New York: The G4 nations of India, Brazil, Germany and Japan have reaffirmed that it is "indispensable" to reform the Security Council through an expansion in permanent and non-permanent seats to enable the UN organ to better deal with the "ever-complex and evolving challenges" to the maintenance of international peace and security. By Yoshita Singh FGN28 US-HARRIS-MODI-MEETING-DIASPORA Kamala Harris meeting Modi is ''coming of age'' moment for Indian diaspora, says her home state newspaper Washington: US Vice President Kamala Harris meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the White House on Thursday afternoon is a "coming of age" moment for the Indian diaspora, a prominent US newspaper in her home state has said on the eve of the historic meeting between the two leaders. By Lalit K Jha FGN35 UK-INDIA-TRAVEL-LD COVISHIELD Vaccine certification for travel must meet 'minimum criteria', says UK London: The UK government has said that COVID-19 vaccine certification from all countries must meet a "minimum criteria" and that it is working with India on a "phased approach" to its international travel norms. By Aditi Khanna FGN17 G20-JAISHANKAR-LD AFGHANISTAN Taliban's commitment not to allow use of Afghan soil for terrorism in any manner should be implemented: Jaishankar New York: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has told the G20 nations that the Taliban's commitment not to allow the use of Afghanistan's soil for terrorism in any manner should be implemented and the world expects a broad-based, inclusive process that involves representation from all sections of the Afghan society. By Yoshita Singh FGN25 US-MODI-LD DIASPORA Indian diaspora has distinguished itself across the world: Modi Washington: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has commended the Indian Diaspora for distinguishing itself across the world, as he received an enthusiastic welcome from the community on his arrival here on a major visit to further enhance Indo-US relations. By Lalit K Jha FGN15 US-MODI-CEOS Modi to interact with global CEOs to highlight opportunities in India Washington: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said he would highlight economic opportunities in India during his meetings with CEOs here. By Lalit K Jha FGN27 US-AUKUS-LD INDIA US rules out adding India or Japan to security alliance with Australia and UK Washington: The US has ruled out adding India or Japan to the new trilateral security partnership with Australia and Britain to meet the challenges of the 21st century in the strategic Indo-Pacific region. By Lalit K Jha FGN29 UN-LANKA-RAJAPAKSA Meaningful reconciliation through domestic institutions is essential to achieve lasting peace: Rajapaksa United Nations: A meaningful reconciliation with the Tamil community through domestic institutions is essential to achieve lasting peace in Sri Lanka, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has said and stressed that his government is ready to engage with all stakeholders and to obtain the support of its international partners in the process. By Yoshita Singh Taipei: Taiwan announced Thursday it has applied to join an 11-nation Pacific trade group, setting up a potential clash with rival Beijing over the status of the island democracy. (AP) FGN26 US-QURESHI-TALIBAN AP Interview: Top Pakistan diplomat details Taliban plan United Nations: Be realistic. Show patience. Engage. And above all, don''t isolate. Those are the pillars of an approach emerging in Pakistan to deal with the fledgling government that is suddenly running the country next door once again — Afghanistan''s resurgent, often-volatile Taliban. (AP) FGN11 VIRUS-UNGA-BIDEN Biden doubles US global donation of COVID-19 vaccine shots Washington: President Joe Biden has announced that the United States is doubling its purchase of Pfizer''s COVID-19 shots to share with the world to 1 billion doses as he embraces the goal of vaccinating 70 per cent of the global population within the next year. (AP) Outlook's annual ranking of India's top 21 Private Medical Universities in 2021 will help students make an informed choice. Outlook-ICARE India's Top Universities Rankings 2021: Top 15 Government Medical Universities Outlook's annual ranking of India's top 15 Government Medical Universities in 2021 will help students make an informed choice. Know what's behind the apparent and what doesn't show. Your journey into the myriad shades of truth with Outlook.

title: Suspended Sri Lankan players may return to competitive cricket
snippet: There is a possibility of the domestic ban imposed on Sri Lankan cricketers Kusal Mendis, Niroshan Dickwella and Danushka Gunathilaka being lifted, provided they show progressive reports on the mandatory counselling they have been asked to undergo.

title: Domestic cricket to commence on Oct. 20
snippet: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) is set to commence the domestic season of 2021/2022 from October 20. According to a senior official of SLC, they have instructed clubs to start their preparations, adhering to the health guidelines issued by the government,

title: Physical location and 'jurisdictional location' are separate matters
snippet: In what should have been a pedestrian application in the District Court, which should have been decided on the bare facts, a District Judge made a wrong decision about the jurisdiction of the court with regard to a certain defendant,

title: Sri Lanka should open schools, but reduce exam pressure: EducationForumSL
snippet: Sri Lanka should open schools as soon as it is safe to do so, but students should not be subject to the same exam pressure as earlier, which is in case a flawed approach that leaves students without reasoning skills,

title: SL begin World Cup preparations today
snippet: Rex Clementine Sri Lanka's cricketers who are in a bio-secure bubble at the Cinnamon Grand in Colombo will end their three day quarantine today and will start group training. Following the group training,

title: As youngsters refuse vaccines; Medics warn Sri Lanka's immunization programme at risk
snippet: As health authorities come under severe pressure due to the lack of interest among youngsters to get the COVID-19 vaccines, medical workers yesterday warned that Sri Lanka's immunization programme will come at risk if youngsters have no confidence on all vaccinations.

title: CoL Committee meets today
snippet: The Cost of Living Committee will meet today to discuss the requests made by milk powder importers regarding the increase in the price of milk powder, Co-operative Services, Marketing Development and Consumer Protection State Minister Lasantha Alagiyawanna said.

title: As youngsters refuse vaccines; Medics warn Sri Lanka's immunization programme at risk
snippet: As health authorities come under severe pressure due to the lack of interest among youngsters to get the COVID-19 vaccines, medical workers yesterday warned that Sri Lanka's immunization programme will come at risk if youngsters have no confidence on all vaccinations.

title: Sri Lanka latest import restrictions should be revisited: Jayasundara
snippet: Sri Lanka central bank's recent import restrictions over 600 items should be revisited as it is hindering a booming service exports of information technology (IT), president's secretary P B Jayasundera said.

title: Sri Lanka Athletics gives priority to Asian Games
snippet: Reemus Fernando  Sri Lanka Athletics will give priority to Asian Games over the Commonwealth Games as the two major sports events take place within five weeks from each other in 2022. The track and field governing body indicated their priorities at a meeting with the National Olympic Committee yesterday.

title: Public Security Minister: Terrorists still at large pose threat to Sri Lanka
snippet: Sarath Weerasekera told Parliament on Wednesday (22) that Sri Lanka would be under threat as long as the IS ideology promising 72 virgins in paradise for those who sacrificed their lives in the name of Jihad existed.

title: Post Offices ease delivery of medicine
snippet: All Post offices and Sub Post offices across the country remain open to handle delivery of medicines. The government facilitates to send the required medicines through main and sub post offices for patients who have registered with every main hospital.

title: Tamil MP held in Sri Lanka over rebel remembrance
snippet: COLOMBO: Sri Lankan police on Thursday arrested a Tamil MP for commemorating a separatist rebel who died campaigning for the minority community, hours after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa called for reconciliation between ethnic groups.

title: First child vaccination rollout to commence today at LRH
snippet: Administering Pfizer vaccines as a shield against the Covid virus for children between the ages of 12 and 19 will commence ..

title: Questionable last will of late Miss Ceylon to be perused in Magisterial inquiry
snippet: The Colombo Chief Magistrate's Court has advised the Counsels for the aggrieved party to make an application before Colombo ..

title: Malaysia relaxes ban on travellers from Sri Lanka
snippet: Malaysia has relaxed a ban on travellers from Sri Lanka and four other countries. Accordingly, those with permanent resident status, long-stay passes, businessmen and investors can enter Malaysia from these five countries.

title: Vital to transform global food systems to be more sustainable: President
snippet: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa stressed that it is essential to transform global food systems to be more sustainable and that all stakeholders should work together in this regard. ..

title: CDB Rankati Launches Its First-Ever Digital Art Competition 'CDB Rankati Siththam Roo 2021'
snippet: Citizens Development Business Finance PLC, in celebration of World Children's Day, announced the launch of their first-ever Digital Art Competition "CDB Ranketi Siththam Roo 2021". The initiative will allow children to explore their creativity and express themselves through art and colour.

snippet: Vaccination of children with congenital diseases who are between the ages of 12 and 19 years commenced today in Colombo, Kurunegala and Anuradhapura districts, Army Commander Gen. Shavendra Silva said.

title: UNP recognizes reduction in daily Covid deaths
snippet: The United National Party (UNP) said it recognized the reduction in the number of daily Covid fatalities in the country achieved through restriction of public mobility by the government. ..

title: GSMB to shut all limestone quarries within 100m radius of Victoria Reservoir overflow level
snippet: The Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) is to take immediate action to remove all limestone quarries located within 100 meters of the Victoria Reservoir overflow level. ..

title: Maldives HDC pulls debut on poor demand
snippet: The issuer, rated Caa1 by Moody's and CCC by Fitch, failed to get enough demand for its targeted deal size, leading it to postpone the fundraising, GlobalCapital Asia understands. The final guidance on the bond was announced at 13% on Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka opp. MP Ranawaka, ex-media secy summoned by CID; MP claims witch hunt
snippet: Sri Lanka opposition MP Patali Champika Ranawaka was summoned by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) Friday (24) morning for a statement. The main opposition Samagi Jana Balvegaya (SJB) MP arrived at the CID headquarters in Colombo to record a statement on a 75-million-rupee 'Pannaraya' promotional campaign launched in 2019 under his Ministry of Megapolis and Western Development during the previous government.

title: SL FM briefs Indian counterpart on actions taken on post-war issues
snippet: Peiris briefed Jaishankar about the action taken by the island nation's government to resolve residual matters after the end of the conflict in May 2009.

title: Petition challenging Selendiva Investment project fixed for November 29
snippet: A Fundamental Rights petition seeking an order prohibiting the Treasury Secretary from selling, leasing, or alienating state properties vested in Selendiva Investments Limited Company was today fixed for November 29 by Supreme Court.

title: Micro Review: 'A Passage North' is an attempt to come to terms with life in the wake of devastation
snippet: Anuk Arudpragasam's Booker Prize-shortlisted novel 'A Passage North' centers on a young man named Tamil Krishan and his journey to war-torn Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka to soon reopen schools with 200 students or fewer for grades 1 to 5
snippet: Sri Lankan students of grades 1 to 5 in schools with a student population of 200 or fewer may soon be able to go back to school, according to Education Ministry Secretary Kapila Perera. Sri Lanka has 5,

title: Decision to remove limestone quarries close to Victoria Dam overflow level
snippet: A number of minor earth tremors have been reported around Victoria Reservoir in recent times. The Ministry of Environment had appointed an intellectual committee to study these minor earth tremors. The committee submitted the report and has recommended taking immediate action to protect Victoria Reservoir dam and its surroundings.

title: World Bank agrees to give USD 100 mn to Sri Lanka
snippet: The World Bank has agreed to give a $100 million loan to support Sri Lanka's efforts to curb the spread of Covid-19, local media reported on Thursday. Continue Reading →

title: Newlywed couple uses ladder to enter house
snippet: A 30-year-old man from Ampara has lodged a complaint with the Uhana Police alleging that he had to climb a ladder to access his upstairs room with his newlywed bride as his parents had locked the entrance to the house as a protest against their marriage.

title: New vaccination drive gets rolling
snippet: The vaccination of children with congenital diseases who are between the ages of 12 and 19 years commenced today in Colombo, Kurunegala and Anuradhapura districts. Pictures show children are administered with Pfizer vaccine at the Lady Ridgeway Hospital for Children (LRH) this morning.

title: 1,300 container loads of essential goods stuck at Ports: Importers
snippet: About 1,300 container loads of essential commodities imported to the country are stagnant in the Colombo port for three months, the importers said. ..

title: Lankan medical specialists urge parents to get their children vaccinated
snippet: This generation of children and youth cannot anymore afford disruptions to their education, which is why experts have called upon governments to re-open schools as soon as possible and get education back on track.

title: Lanka Premier League to be played in December
snippet: The Lanka Premier League (LPL) is to be held from 04th to 23rd December 2021, the Sri Lanka Cricket Board said today.   T

title: Sri Lanka health authorities deny allegations of artificially lowering daily COVID-19 cases
snippet: Sri Lanka's health authorities have denied allegations of artificially lowering the daily COVID-19 caseload in order to have Sri Lanka removed from a pandemic red list, a top health official said. Responding to claims that a recent drop in daily cases was due to reduced PCR testing,
